item.title: Rubbish everywhere, 10th October
item.description:
The pictures show exactly the state of Kashgar Road! How often do the roads and pavements get swept clean? Its disgusting and people have started to contribute their rubbish to the current mess. Am happy to clean it up if you refund my council tax ive paid for the year.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kashgar Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bikes parked on tactile paving, 10th October
item.description:
The numbers for the bikes are in the attached photographs. The Lime bikes were parked to cause maximum inconvenience and hazard for blind and visually impaired pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frampton Park Road, Hackney, London

item.title: More flytipped rubbish on Grove Lane, 9th October
item.description:
This green bin left out continues to be a problem. New dumped rubbish has left it in the current state as per the photo taken this evening. This bin is causing the street to be always in a state of mess and should be permanently removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Grove Lane, Camberwell, London

item.title: Street light shining into property, 9th October
item.description:
The street light is shining into the bedroom windows opposite it and one of these is the a children's bedroom and everyone is being kept awake. This was reported a few years ago and the front of the lamp was blackened and a piece of black painted cardboard was put inside to block the light bulb but this has fallen and the black faded. Please could these things be redone to block the light as much as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warwick Square Mews, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dear Hackney Council here is some fly tipped mess for you to clean up again you love cleaning other people's mess up so here you go. Fly tipped mattress., 9th October
item.description:
Dirty fly tipped mattress clean up team required. Someone has fly tipped at the expense of Hackney Council. Needs to be picked up ASAP this is horrible and disgusting for other tenants to see.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Daintry Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped wheelie bin, 9th October
item.description:
The unofficial dog poo bin that was abandoned on the Warren has now reached a point where it is overflowing. To avoid this dumped wheel bin from being buried under a mountain of poo bags, please remove it. The bin is located exactly outside No77 on the field.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broomfield Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown trees - huge trees, 9th October
item.description:
